clinical_study.brief_title: Precise Measurement of Pediatric Defibrillation Thresholds
clinical_study.official_title: Defibrillation Thresholds in a Pediatric Cohort Using Binary Search Protocol

brief_summary.textblock: Patients who receive an implantable cardioverter-defibrillator (ICD) usually undergo testing at the end of the ICD procedure to measure the amount of energy able to successfully defibrillate the heart (defibrillation threshold testing, or DFT). This study proposes to perform that measurement in pediatric patients already undergoing clinically necessary ICD procedures, with the measurement performed using a binary search method that has been previously validated in adult cohorts. We hypothesize that pediatric DFTs, when precisely measured, may be lower than previously assumed from extrapolation of adult data.

primary_outcome.measure: Defibrillation threshold as measured by the binary search protocol
primary_outcome.time_frame: During clinical ICD procedure, as a single event

secondary_outcome.measure: Do DFTs vary amongst pediatric patients who have had different types of ICD systems implanted?
secondary_outcome.time_frame: During clinical ICD procedure, as a single event

secondary_outcome.measure: How often do these pediatric patients have intrinsic slow heart rate and default to pacing in the immediate post-defibrillation period?
secondary_outcome.time_frame: During clinical ICD procedure, as a single event

study_pop.textblock: All patients seen by the electrophysiology service at Children's Hospital Boston who are identified to be at very high risk of sudden cardiac death and in need of an ICD

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Current follow-up at Children's Hospital Boston
- Children with current or planned ICDs who are scheduled by their primary electrophysiologist for clinically necessary assessment/re-assessment of defibrillation threshold
- If the patient has an ICD system with a non-transvenous shock coil: weight ≤35kg at time of initial implant, with current weight <50kg
- If the patient has an ICD system with a conventional transvenous shock coil: current weight ≤60kg
Exclusion Criteria:
- Clinical failure of any system component not able to be addressed by hardware repair or exchange
- Hemodynamic instability that in the judgment of the primary electrophysiologist warrants abbreviation of DFT assessment
- Unsuccessful induction of fibrillation during DFT testing
